intro: Steffensia tumida, commonly known as the inflated bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its unique, inflated, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped, while its stems are erect and branching. Steffensia tumida is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
